author: Vickie Sandlin
title: No Mercy to Wildcats
text: Cougars win 64-7 under Friday Night Lights Vickie Sandlin Posted: 10/01/2015 06:13:13 PM MDT Updated: 10/01/2015 06:16:56 PM MDT Before the first half could end, the Sedgwick County Cougars already had scored 52 points over Holly. As the second half began, the clock could only be stopped for injury and a change of possession. The Cougars will take on the 4-0 Haxtun Bulldogs this Friday night in Julesburg (Vickie Sandlin) The Sedgwick County Cougars advance to 4-0 after Friday's non-conference win against Holly by a score of 64-7. Cougars took the opening drive at the 35 yard line and scored in less than fifty seconds. The Cougars scored on Trey Walter's hand off pass to Cole McKinley. Tyler Woodhams on the next two touchdowns, and an interception the Cougars led 24-0 at the end of the first quarter. Starting the second quarter a touchdown by Chad Mikelson continued the Cougars lead. Another interception by Woodhams led to another touchdown by Mikelson making the lead 38-0 with 8:45 left in the half. Holly picked off yet again by Mikelson for a touchdown. A fumbled snap gave the Cougars the ball again with 4:40 left in the half. McKinley with a touchdown led the gain into Mercy rule at 52-0. Extra point attempt blocked by Holly. Before the half could end Trey Walter catches interception and runs in for a Cougar touchdown. Mercy clock running the Wildcats started the half but were forced to punt. Walter still in as quarterback made a 35 yard run for a touchdown, but conversion was no good. Late in the fourth quarter, Holly made their first touchdown off of a quarterback sneak. The extra point was good making the score 64-7 with 3:15 left in the game. After a deep kick and 34 yard return by Brennan Ehmke, the game clock ran out. Cougars with the win. The Cougars take on the Haxtun Bulldogs (4-0) at home on Friday, October 2 for their first league game. Advertisement
